Class ShowroomAddEditViewController

java.lang.Object
com.example.theaterproject.Controllers.ShowroomAddEditViewController
public class ShowroomAddEditViewController extends Object
Controller for the showroom add/edit dialog view.

This controller manages the UI for adding new showrooms or editing existing showrooms. It handles showroom name and capacity input validation, and manages the list of screenings for the showroom. Users can add, edit, and remove screenings from the showroom.

  • Constructor Details

    • ShowroomAddEditViewController

      public ShowroomAddEditViewController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller after the FXML file has been loaded. Sets up input validation listeners for numeric inputs.

    • setupInputValidation

      private void setupInputValidation()
      Sets up input validation for the capacity text field. Restricts input to numeric values only.

    • onSaveButtonClick

      private void onSaveButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the save button click event. Validates all inputs and creates a new showroom or updates an existing one if validation passes.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the save button

    • onAddScreeningButtonClick

      private void onAddScreeningButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the add screening button click event. Opens the screening dialog for creating a new screening in this showroom.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the add button

    • onEditScreeningButtonClick

      private void onEditScreeningButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the edit screening button click event. Opens the screening dialog for editing the selected screening. Shows an error if no screening is selected.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the edit button

    • onRemoveScreeningButtonClick

      private void onRemoveScreeningButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the remove screening button click event. Removes the selected screening from the showroom's screening list. Shows an error if no screening is selected.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the remove button

    • validateAndGetShowroomName

      private String validateAndGetShowroomName()
      Validates the showroom name input (must be non-empty and not exceed 100 characters).
      Returns:
      the validated showroom name, or null if validation fails

    • validateAndGetCapacity

      private int validateAndGetCapacity()
      Validates the showroom capacity input (must be between 1 and 10,000).
      Returns:
      the validated capacity, or -1 if validation fails

    • saveShowroom

      private void saveShowroom(String name, int capacity, javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Saves the showroom to the service. Creates a new showroom if one doesn't exist, otherwise updates the existing showroom. Displays a success message upon completion.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the showroom
      capacity - the seating capacity of the showroom
      pEvent - the action event (used for closing the dialog)

    • setShowroomEditView

      public void setShowroomEditView(Showroom pShowroom)
      Sets the showroom to be edited and populates the form with its data. If no showroom is provided, initializes the form for creating a new showroom.
      Parameters:
      pShowroom - the showroom to edit, or null if creating a new showroom

    • openScreeningView

      private void openScreeningView(Screening pScreening)
      Opens the screening add/edit dialog for creating a new screening or editing an existing one.
      Parameters:
      pScreening - the screening to edit, or null if creating a new screening

    • handleScreeningResult

      private void handleScreeningResult(Screening originalScreening, Screening resultScreening)
      Handles the result from the screening dialog. Adds the new screening to the list if it's a new screening, or updates the existing one.
      Parameters:
      originalScreening - the original screening (null if creating a new one)
      resultScreening - the screening returned from the dialog
